title-group.article-title: Constancy and Perpetuity: Simplifying or Camouflaging?

abstract.p: This work examines the validity and the legitimacy of the assumption of constancy and/or perpetuity—often used in theory, practice, and education in finance. Many of the major results in the existing literature (such as weighted average cost of capital, Modigliani-Miller value invariance propositions, and others, which are based on these assumptions) are thrown into clear relief in an effort to understand and highlight the weakness or the general usefulness of those results. In this work, we bring the scattered research under one umbrella and focus a critical spotlight on the constancy and perpetuity postulates.
